## Under review: Estimation of the Average Treatment Effect in Causal Survival Analysis: Practical Recommendations

<img src="project_1_banner.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain" onclick="window.open('https://arxiv.org/abs/2210.07278', 'blank');"/>


<a href="" target="_blank">arXiv Preprint</a> | <a href="https://github.com/chvoinot/Simple_simulation_causal_survival" target="_blank">Code</a><br> 

This article explores causal survival analysis, which combines causal
inference and survival analysis to assess the effect of a treatment on
time-to-event outcomes in the presence of censoring. Specifically, we
focus on estimating the ATE for time-to-event data with static treatment
assignment, baseline covariates, and right-censoring.
